newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss climber is fifth to die on Matterhorn.
newsitem.headline: Swiss climber is fifth to die on Matterhorn.

text.p: A 59-year-old Swiss man fell to his death while climbing the Matterhorn on Saturday, the fifth climber to die on Switzerland's most famous mountain since mid-July, police said.

The man, who was not named, was climbing the 4,477-metre (14,684-foot) mountain on the Swiss-Italian border with a companion when he plunged 300 metres (1,000 feet). Police said the cause of the fall was not immediately known.
At least 37 climbers have died in the Swiss Alps since mid-July as the summer tourist season coincided with a treacherous high-altitude mix of snow, heat and thunderstorms.
